DYAD: ALGERIA-MALI

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID4361

TERRMID: MID4361 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID4361 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4361 from CM narrative, Algerian planes briefly violated Malian airspace before returning to Algeria. Coded not territory because the border was not disputed, per Huth and Allee (2002). 

TERRLINK: MID4361 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4361 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MARITMID-CER: MID4361 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID-CER: MID4361 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID-CER: MID4361 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4361 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-NOTES:

COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4 2002-2010:

MID4361
rivalry=432615 nationa=ALGERIA nationb=MALI MID4361 20031004-20031004 
 revtype1a=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0
lhostb=NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

Algerian planes briefly violated Malian airspace before returning to Algeria. First day of dispute was on 10/4/2003 and last day of dispute was on 10/4/2003.

SOURCES: Huth, Paul K., and Todd L. Allee. The democratic peace and territorial conflict in the twentieth century. Vol. 82. Cambridge University Press, 2002.
